result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 2:53pm 
Defendant Jaquan D Johnson appears by telephone from the Milwaukee House of Corrections where he is in custody.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin.   
The Court notes that the Jefferson Public Defender filed a letter-notice earlier this week confirming that Mr. Johnson continues to qualify for PD representation and they continue efforts to appoint successor counsel. 
Mr. Johnson agrees to adjournment to January, to allow further time for the PD to appoint counsel.  
The Court makes reference to the anticipated judicial rotation and indicates that the Court holds open Mr. Johnson's right to substitute until January 9th. 
recess 2:56pm 

NEXT:  Status Conference (status of PD appointment of counsel) on January 9th at 2:30pm--arrangements are to be made for Mr. Johnson to appear remotely (Mr. Johnson indicated during the hearing that he anticipates being at the Milwaukee HOC

[MK] case called at 8:40am 
Defendant Jaquan D Johnson in court, in custody, with Attorney Cassi Nelson.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Officer R. Nieto- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--cross examination by Attorney Nelson
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Johnson committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 9:00am

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on June 22nd at 11:00am-only counsel need to appear,  (2) Status Conference on June 30th at 9:00am (Mr. Johnson remains in the JCJ awaiting a 6/9/22 revocation hearing)

Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order to Seal Victim Key

[ml] Case called at 1:13PM
[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Jaquan D Johnson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
The State advises that it does not yet have Victim Rights Compliance, however it will gain Victim Rights Compliance within the next ten days.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no acts or threats of violence
--no direct contact with Victim 1 as referred to in the Criminal Complaint and Victim Witness Key; Defendant may have third party contact with the Victim for the purposes of child exchange, as long as it does not violate any law or standing order

The Court inquires if there is a Victim present that wishes to be heard. There is no response.

recess 1:21PM

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 04/22 at 8:30AM in Branch III
